title: Fleming Discovers Penicillin
summary: On September 28, 1928, Scottish bacteriologist Alexander Fleming returned to his laboratory to discover that mold — Penicillium notatum — had contaminated a petri dish and was killing the surrounding bacteria. This accidental discovery led to the development of penicillin, the world's first antibiotic. It is estimated to have saved over 200 million lives since its widespread introduction in the 1940s.
